meanings.definition: The movement or growth of a plant in response to light.
meanings.sent1: Phototropisms help plants grow towards sunlight for energy.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study phototropisms to understand how plants react to light.
meanings.sent3: The phototropisms of the flowers made them look like they were dancing in the sun.

meanings.sent5: The teacher used a vivid illustration to explain phototropisms to the students.

meanings.definition: The orientation of an organism or part of an organism in response to light.
meanings.sent1: Phototropisms in animals help them find the best spot to bask in the sun.
meanings.sent2: Birds show phototropisms by turning their bodies towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The phototropisms of the cat made it follow the sunbeam around the room.
